clinical_study.official_title: The ASTHMA-Educator: A Novel Algorithmic Software Tool to Help Manage Asthma

brief_summary.textblock: Through this study, the investigators developed the ASTHMA-Educator mobile application, and evaluated its use among adult asthma patients at Montefiore.

detailed_description.textblock: Through this study, the investigators developed the ASTHMA-Educator mobile application, and evaluated its use through 2 phases: 1) Phase 1 = process outcomes evaluation with 30 patients); and 2) Phase 2 (longitudinal clinical evaluation with 40 patients receiving the intervention at baseline, 2 months, 4 months, and 6 months). The study's primary outcome is asthma control.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This is a single-arm proof of concept study to evaluate the impact of the ASTHMA-Educator on process and clinical outcomes

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline asthma control to 2, 4, and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Asthma symptom burden as measured by the Asthma Control Test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline asthma knowledge to immediately post-intervention, 2 months, 4 months, and 6 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, immediately post-intervention, 2 months, 4 months, 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Asthma knowledge as measured by the validated Asthma Knowledge Questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient satisfaction measured by the Client Satisfaction Questionnaire-8
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately post-intervention at the baseline visit, 2 months, 4 months, 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Patient satisfaction measured by the Client Satisfaction Questionnaire-8

secondary_outcome.measure: Time spent in using the mobile application
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately post-intervention at the baseline visit
secondary_outcome.description: Time spent in using the mobile application

secondary_outcome.measure: Asthma quality of life measured by the mini-Asthma Quality of Life Questionnaire (mini-AQLQ)
secondary_outcome.description: Patients' asthma quality of life measured by the mini-Asthma Quality of Life Questionnaire (mini-AQLQ)

arm_group.description: The ASTHMA-Educator mobile application for patient-centered asthma education. The application is administered via on-site iPad (tablet).

intervention.description: The on-site delivered ASTHMA-Educator mobile application.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: Adults (>18 years) with: (a) severe asthma (i.e. at least one asthma-related ED visit and/or hospitalization in the previous year); (b) access to a smartphone with short message service (SMS) capability; (c) English speaking; (d) able to give informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria: (a) use of oral corticosteroids in the 2 weeks prior to the baseline visit; (b) pregnancy; (c) severe psychiatric or cognitive problems that would prohibit an individual from understanding and completing the protocol; and (d) patients that previously received the ASTHMAXcel application.

patient_data.ipd_description: The investigators will share de-identified and aggregated study findings.
